how do i remove a branch from a git repo? show me the command

To remove a branch from a Git repository, you can use the `git branch` command with the `-d` option. If you've already pushed the branch to your remote repository, you'll need to use the `-D` option instead.

Here are the commands:

**Removing a local branch:**

```bash
git branch -d <branch_name>
```

Replace `<branch_name>` with the name of the branch you want to delete.

**Removing a remote branch:**

```bash
git push origin --delete <branch_name>
```

Again, replace `<branch_name>` with the name of the branch you want to delete. This will delete the branch from your remote repository, but only if it's not checked out locally.

Note that if you've never pushed the branch to a remote repository and you're trying to delete it, Git won't allow you to do so unless you use the `-D` option:

```bash
git branch -D <branch_name>
```

This will force-delete the local branch.
summary: Removing a Branch from a Git Repository
